org.owasp.esapi.errors.AccessControlException

assertSecureChannel

public void assertSecureChannel(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
                         throws org.owasp.esapi.errors.AccessControlException
This implementation ignores the built-in isSecure() method and uses the URL to determine if the request was transmitted over SSL. This is because SSL may have been terminated somewhere outside the container.

Throws:
org.owasp.esapi.errors.AccessControlException

assertSecureRequest

public void assertSecureRequest()
                         throws org.owasp.esapi.errors.AccessControlException

Throws:
org.owasp.esapi.errors.AccessControlException

assertSecureRequest

public void assertSecureRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
                         throws org.owasp.esapi.errors.AccessControlException
Ensures that the current request uses SSL and POST to protect any sensitive parameters in the querystring from being sniffed or logged. For example, this method should be called from any method that uses sensitive data from a web form. This method uses HTTPUtilities#getCurrentRequest() to obtain the current HttpServletRequest object

Throws:
org.owasp.esapi.errors.AccessControlException - if security constraints are not met

getCurrentRequest

public javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest getCurrentRequest()
